summary:
Jon has a passion for the cross-section of where culture, cycling, startups, and sales meet. He has 17 years of racing experience from the streets dodging traffic in alleycats to track sprinting internationally to amateur road racing and criteriums to digging deep in Dutch mud racing cyclocross. For Jon, “it all comes back to the bike.”

The roots of Twotone go back in 2007, when Jon cofounded a fixed gear focused bike shop in Atlanta, GA named No Brakes. Jon's clothes nearly always matched his track bike & he earned the nickname Twotone. He cut his teeth on promoting his own shop, the brands they sold, and even suppliers, athletes, and other organisations they partnered with all before Instagram! Those entrepreneurial roots grew into the hold your line, you'll be fine full-send approach to how we run our business today. 

A 10 year old nickname became a Dutch BV in 2014 & Twotone has become THE one-stop-shop for cycling savvy sales, marketing and PR across Europe in the USA. Our earliest accounts began with brands like Zwift (then still beta!), Wahoo (before the Elemnt & Kickr!) & komoot after meeting the founders at SxSW in Austin, Texas. We're proud to work with the biggest names in the business but still advocate for the underdog brands in our roster as big ones like Zwift, Wahoo & komoot started small.
​
Now a team of 7 hailing from 4 countries, Twotone confidently delivers cycling- savvy brand strategy, commercial services, communications consulting and content production implementation to brands large & small around the world in partnership along with trusted agencies and freelancers across Europe.

Before Twotone, Jon sold to companies in industries like L&D/HR, App/Software Consulting, Translation and Localization, and even B2C selling in the cycling industry back at No Brakes.

At Springest, Jon learned from and helped HR Managers and L&D Directors who experienced unmotivated employees, teams lacking the tools to find and book the courses they want & HR depts with excessive admin on automate-able tasks

Previously, Jon led new sales for Big Nerd Ranch, Europe in Amsterdam. Before Europe? Jon did sales for BNR and Highgroove Studios in Atlanta. He earned real-world entrepreneurial experience in co-founding and running a bicycle shop, No Brakes. Jon also cut his teeth in building online presence & internet strategy for the bike shop. 

Before that, as an intern at ALTA Language Services, he was focused on online marketing activities and helped establish an innovative online experience along with an SEO strategy to drive new business nationwide.

projects.title: Samsung - Cycling - Les Domestiques (72andSunny)
projects.description:
Les Domestiques is a campaign about the unsung heroes of cycling, the workers behind the names on the leaderboard: the domestiques. In tight collaboration with Samsung, Fabian Cancellara, Grégory Rast, the rest of the Trek Factory Racing Team and cycling legends Jens Voigt and Phil Liggett, 72andSunny created a film to kick off the campaign and introduce the domestiques for the launch of the Tour de France. Socially 72andSunny also launched the Domestique du Jour, a twitter based activation led by celebrated cyclist Jens Voigt to honor the domestiques along the route, and the Diary of a Domestique, a blog chronicling the journey of the hero domestique from the main film, Grégory Rast, throughout this year’s Tour de France.

Find more here.
Diary: http://www.trekfactoryracing.com/blog/diary-domestique-july-19
Domestique du Jour: https://twitter.com/search?src=typd&q=%23domestiquedujour&lang=nl

profile_positions.title: European PR Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Tiny Spark helps creative businesses engage their best prospects through better positioning, content and lead generation. At Tiny Spark, I help with ignitiondg.com business development.

We'll work with you to clarify your sales & marketing strategy and help you refresh your proposition. Then we'll point you at the prospects who might want what you do, and start conversations with them. We'll use a mix of lead generation activity - sales calls, email campaigns & social media - and work as part of your company to create and implement a sustainable new business strategy that delivers opportunities to win new business regularly.

Boasting experience from working with a lot of different startups, big companies and soon to big companies, they're PROs at helping clients decide what NOT to build and when to release / ship.

profile_positions.title: Business Development

profile_positions.description:
Register now: http://sales4startups.org/location/amsterdam/

We LOVE Sales -- Sales4StartUps is sales a education program for startup technology companies. We do this through events and content.

Google "Sales4StartUps" for more & follow Amsterdam events & updates here twitter.com/s4s_amsterdam

Sales is an important yet under valued piece of a b2b startup's existence. Most startups are founded by technical founders or business people who are not familiar with what it takes to successfully sell and market their offering. Whether you're at the idea stage or have a well funded startup with traction, this class will provide you with the knowledge and actionable items to hit the ground running.

What's it like?

https://twitter.com/woutlaban/status/575971862892687360
https://twitter.com/sabben/status/575967760703975424

profile_positions.title: Trainer

profile_positions.description:
Springest is a vertical search engine for professional courses and education. We're active in 6 markets: The Netherlands (origin, market leader), United Kingdom, Germany, Russia, Belgium and the United States. Springest's goal is to become the Amazon of learning.

We add value to our educational data by providing users with tools to search, filter, compare, review and share training courses and other products for learning & development.

Springest is the best way to compare and book training courses. Our employee focussed SaaS LMS integrates within your intranet and with your existing tools. We work with companies who are experiencing one or more of the following:

• obstacles in motivating employees to pursue learning autonomously
• challenges for teams due to a lack of tools to find and book the courses they want
• overwhelmed HR depts with excessive admin on potentially automate-able tasks

Springest Go helps make this process more efficient and pleasant. By improving the impact of your employee development, we help your team go further! Read here business.springest.co.uk and watch here http://bit.ly/1mUiwWs (2.5m video)

At Springest, I help with:

- Springest Go Corporate Sales & Corporate Business Development for UK, US, and other international markets.
- Springest Go marketing for UK, US, and other international markets.
- Global partnerships for Springest Go.
- Learning & Development Provider Sales for Springest.com
profile_positions.title: 'Go' Business Development & Global Partnerships Director

profile_positions.description:
Jon helped further Undeveloped.nl's premium domain brokerage success. Undeveloped was started with the belief that domain names should be treated with care and traded with trust:

Treated with care:
- easily found
- transparency about ownership and price
- clean and clear design language that leaves no confusion

Traded with trust:
- direct contact between buyers and sellers with each transaction
- clear information at every step
- secure payment and escrow service

volunteer_experiences.description: As a mentor at Startupbootcamp I share my entrepreneurial experience and my professional sales and business development expertise with the Startupbootcamp accelerator companies. The lessons I've learned in my career and tools I've adapted over time are valuable to these teams to help them grow an early stage business. It is an honor to be involved in such a prestigious program with so many of the best and brightest entrepreneurial minds here in the Netherlands.

@StartupNextAMS will help set your team apart when applying to accelerators or pitching to investors.

#StartupNextAMS is an intensive five-week program that gives your team the tools and mentorship needed to navigate the early stages of building a startup.

Startups accepted into the program will attend a 3-hour session once a week for five weeks. Through a structured approach of group discussions, mentor sessions and pre-work deliverables, teams walk away with the skills needed to validate their business ideas, a customer development strategy, a completed market and competitive analysis, a minimum viable product (MVP), and an investor-ready pitch deck.

More info here: https://startupnext.co/amsterdam

A conference series and online publication that brings together proven sales execs and emerging startup founders to share their lessons and experiences in sales automation and tech sales.

Saleshacker.com is the online publication for all things sales automation and tech sales. Bringing together proven sales leaders and up and coming startup founders to share their lessons and experiences in generating more revenue using less resources.
As a mentor at Startup Weekend Utrecht I shared my entrepreneurial experience and my professional sales and business development expertise with the teams competing in the three day challenge.
